title: Omg, Rito Is Giving Out Free Skins!!!

embed.description: Say farewell to your friends, for Snowdown has passed. The Legend of the Poro King conquered at last. We won some, we lost some, we tossed many poros. Some landed and some missed, that is just how it goes. Who really won this Snowdown? Only the poros know.

body:
I can't believe they're actually giving out free skins {{summoner:30}} 
Which skin does everyone hope to get?

"Over the next few days, we'll be rewarding positive League of Legends players with a classic Mystery Gift as thanks for being such an awesome part of our community. If you haven’t received a chat restriction, ranked restriction, 14-day ban or permanent ban in 2014, and you meet the requirements to receive a Mystery Gift (you’re Level 5 or higher and there are at least 10 skins you don’t own), you’re on our list!" - Rito 2015 Jan 6

TL:DR: free mystery-gift for everyone that never got restricted.

This isn't the first or last time (I'm pretty sure) that Riot has given rewards for good behavior, they're aiming for a less toxic and a more friendly community. You should try not fighting with your teammates and/or enemy team, if it seems like you get too easily provoked try turning off all chat and muting all your teammates if you feel like they're not making any valuable team communication, I've seen high elo players do this constantly to help them focus on the game and not get distracted from their goal of winning the match. 

When I'm in a match I always tell myself that it's not worth fighting with someone during a match since I can be most likely punished for it and it would cause the team to focus more in fighting with eachother then actually winning the game but sometimes I do feel the need to correct my teammates if they feel I did something wrong and if all fails I will just ignore them no matter what they say to try to provoke me back into the conversation.

Just remember you're already winning the argument if someone is desperately trying to get your attention and can't seem to get it, plus just report them in the end.



Also for the Bronze issue, try watching some League of Legends videos on youtube, there's actually a streamer I enjoy watching called gbay99 that gives great advice on how to play the game and helped improve me a lot. I'm actually Ranked Gold which might not seem like much to some players but  from someone that was stuck in silver for a good amount of time I'm over the moon about it, feels like a great achievement.  



Sorry for the long read, and I wish you the best!

You know what's wrong with this post? It has nothing to do with what I'm talking about. Sure, I could "get gud" and "don't be toxic". But Riot would still marginalize anyone that is in Bronze and has received a chat restriction. Seriously, this is an entire group of people that Riot basically ignores while actively trying to thank the community for playing. You may feel that it's justified, THEY may feel that it's justified too. I'm just saying, what's the point of playing a game when the entire community's response to you is "be something else or gtfo".

Try thinking of it this way, Btw this will seem a little cold and harsh but you gotta try to see both sides of this. To get into Bronze takes no effort what so ever, not saying all players in bronze don't try but you literally can lose every game and end up there. Now why would you believe that should be rewarded?  Effort is rewarded, having good behavior = effort, playing well = effort. It's not like because you're Bronze you don't even count as a player since you do get any compensation the community as a whole gets so its not like it's completely excluded from existence but as mentioned before Riot is aiming for a friendlier community so they're rewarding players that help with that goal regardless of rank.

It's not about getting rewarded. Again. It's about feeling like a valuable member of the community. You say it's not like because I'm Bronze and salty I don't count, but that's exactly how they're acting. Seriously, all I want is a "hey, thanks for playing the game, we really appreciate you!", but they don't. "Oh, it's not their intention to make you feel unappreciated through exclusion, they're just not appreciating you through exclusion". They appreciate good players and "well-behaved" players, but not their entire playerbase. not me.

To be honest, you get to enjoy a game for free, make friends, etc.  I never had a company that honest cared enough to say 'Thanks for playing' when I should be thanking them for putting their time and effort to make a game I enjoy.

Every online video game I have played except this one sends out an email TO EVERY PLAYER around new years saying "Thanks for playing, hope you had a great year, we have great stuff in store for next year", at the very least. Plenty design special items to give to everyone and maybe give out some of the currency.

Making your customers feel like they don't matter to you is not a viable strategy for success. But as long as you personally feel appreciated, who cares if I don't right?

Well you said it yourself, you were being toxic. That actually hurts their game and community so why should you get anything in return? You spent money on the game for content that you wanted within the game its not like you went 'Hey Riot here is some free money, nah I don't need anything in return'. This free mystery skin gift was given to players that actually didn't hurt the game in any way. 

An example of what you're doing.

There's a bakery sale for charity going on in your neighborhood, you come in  because you're hungry and give $1 for a cookie that they're selling and then start fighting with the people walking around in the event which may cause some of them to leave out of stress or dislike of your behavior but you donated right? What does that matter? You should be thanked anyways because you gave $1 to charity for that cookie.

**TL;DR: We have all ruined someone's game, and we have all had our own games ruined. No one is perfect. I have tried to contribute positively. I have supported Riot's game. There is no reason to not give me a thank you note, other than deciding that I don't matter to the game. **

Do you know why Riot calls it toxicity? It's because it spreads. They said that 95% or so of the players in this game are not consistently toxic, yet almost every game has toxicity. Why is that? It's because almost every player has little "outbursts". It's a particularly high stakes game, you're not doing well, one guy is feeding pretty hard, maybe you didn't get your main champion or role, and you freak a bit.   Everyone has those little outbursts, prompting others that it's okay to do them too. The community has mostly decided that if you don't make a habit of it, it's forgivable. So we get toxicity 90% of games, because 1/10 people is almost guaranteed to have a baby outburst.

Do you see how your analogy doesn't work now? If this is a bakesale going on, they would have difficult customers that had bad times 9 times out of 10, but it's all worth it to help the charity (or make bank, in Riot's case). 

Now to really make this analogy work, I would need to consistently go to this bake sale, pay $1 for a cookie, and cause problems to the point that the owners are like "you're only getting a cookie if you say less than 3 things every 5 minutes". But I like these cookies, so I grit my teeth and do it. That ends and things resume to the way they were before.

Then X amount of time later, the sale ends and they send out thank you letters. "Thank you for our top spenders, you get a special cookie we designed just for you! Also thank you to 90% of our customers, even though you had some bad days and generally created a bad environment, you get a random, generic cookie." Oh, but those 10% of the people that we decided were overly contributing to the negative environment that everyone created? Yeah you get nothing, not even a thank you note, even though you contributed to the charity too.

Ffs. I don't know why I even bother trying. No one will accept that Riot does anything wrong if it doesn't affect them.

i don't want to contribute to an argument, but i cant help it right now. for one they cant send out a letter to each and every person that plays league, thats why they put it on their website. and i know you're thinking, "well it doesnt take much effort to post one thing for everyone to see." and i understand that, but it would take too much effort to send out a thank you letter to over 70 million accounts.

also, i understand everyone has their little outbursts, thats why you dont get punished for one report, but if you're consistantly causing a problem, you can't expect riot to not do anything about it. I've been playing for years and i've never been banned or had any kind of chat restriction, although i have a little outbursts here and there.

finally, its not like they completely ignore bronze players, you just cant expect the same treatment as a challenger player. how do you think they would feel if they worked that hard just to get the same rewards as a bronze player that only trolled in some provisionals and got bronze 5 (not saying thats you, just as an example). so they will give better rewards for higher ranking players.

and its not like riot just looks at the accounts and goes,"ew look a bronze player with a recent chat restriction." honestly if you keep the fact that you had a chat restriction to yourself and dont feed, its not like anyone is going to marginalize you as the lowest person in league. nobody would care honestly.

This isn't about toxicity, rank, or the community. All I'm asking for is a thank you note that isn't directed at any type of player just for supporting them. I don't care how they do it, and I don't care who else they thank for specifically doing something. If they can go out of their way to thank two types of players, it wouldn't kill them to put up a note thanking all the players. 


Seriously, it's amazing that "Riot should thank all of its customers for their support" gets so much disagreement...

Hello, The AFK Farmer. I'm sorry that you weren't a part of this round of thank you gifts but I do want to emphasize that we are thankful for every single player we have, regardless of contribution or skill level.

Many of us at Riot (more than not) are also Bronze players, or don't play ranked at all. In that case, these Rioters don't get the ranked rewards either. Ranked rewards and the behavior thank yous that just went out are only a few of the programs we run, and are specifically targeted at certain objectives like fostering competition and sportsmanship.

Our continued endeavors to add new features like team builder, keep the game fresh with end of season updates, and run community events such as art competitions, are a few examples of something we do as a thank you to all players. You guys have made LoL the most played game and we are working hard to live up to that high praise.

If we should be doing a better job of communicating to players about how we try to continually earn your much appreciated patronage, I'd like to apologize for that and I'll make sure to ping someone about how we are doing and how me might improve.

If your ban was from Leaverbuster, you should be fine, at least according to that news post.

The specific quote is: "If you haven’t received a chat restriction, ranked restriction, 14-day ban or permanent ban in 2014." Leaverbuster doesn't give restrictions of any sort, and only gives bans of up to 7 days. The listed sanctions are all related to the behavioral systems.

So, if you've never been pegged for toxicity, but *have* been hit by Leaverbuster, you should still receive the benefit.
